did.head: Descriptive Summary

physdesc.label: Extent
physdesc.extent: (20 manuscripts boxes, 1 .5 manuscript box, 1 audiocassette box)

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: Stanford University. Libraries. Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives.

did.abstract: Primarily research materials about Donaldina Cameron, including some original materials and interviews. Martin's papers include manuscripts, correspondence, cassette tapes, and photographs.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: There are no restrictions on access.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Public Services Librarian of the Dept. of Special Collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Mildred Martin Papers. M0780. Dept. of Special Collections, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of Carolyn M. Lyons, the daughter of Mildred Martin, 1994.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: American writer, known particularly for her book CHINATOWN'S ANGRY ANGEL, the story of Donaldina Cameron's early years fighting the yellow slave trade. Cameron House, a community services agency serving the Chinese in San Francisco, was named for Donaldina Cameron, and the agency she founded, Ming Quong, survives in the South Bay.

scopecontent.head: Collection Scope and Content Summary
scopecontent.p: Primarily research materials about Donaldina Cameron, including some original materials and interviews. Martin's papers include manuscripts, correspondence, cassette tapes, and photographs.

did.unittitle: Series 1. Chinatown's Angry Angel / Donaldina Cameron project files

scopecontent.p: Contains manuscripts, correspondence, research files, notes, speeches, and articles relating to Donaldina Cameron and her crusade to free Chinese immigrant women from slavery and servitude in San Francisco, Palo Alto, and the Bay Area.

Series 3. Evelyn Miller Berger Brown manuscripts

scopecontent.p: Contains manuscripts of articles written by Evelyn Miller Berger Brown, some in collaboration with Mildred Martin. Also contains Mildred Martin's correspondence with magazine and periodicals trying to get the articles published.

Series 5. Christian religious organizations and materials

scopecontent.p: Contains photocopies of the reports of the Occidental Board and the Women's Occidental Board as well as notes about same. Also includes religious pamphlets from various Chinese Christian churches in the Bay Area.
Contains photographs used primarily in Chinatown's Angry Angel.

did.unittitle: Bulletin of Concerned Asian Scholars, Vol. 4, no. 3, 1972 Fall

scopecontent.p: Contains special issue on Asian America

did.unittitle: Outlook : the newsletter of On Lok

scopecontent.p: Contains audiotapes of interviews of people who knew or were associated with Donaldina Cameron and speeches given by Mildred Martin. Also contains a videotape produced by Cameron House, a community center for Christian Chinese Americans in San Francisco's Chinatown.
